Token.Abstract: The main object through which you can interact with PayPal and associated hardware devices such as card readers and chip & pin devices.
The interface to interact with the card reader
The interface to interact with checkin services and merchant locations
The interface to process payments with card swipe, keyed in/scanned, and checkins
A helper to establish OAuth credentials on behalf of your application for a merchant.
Should you wish to handle your own network requests, you can set this singleton which the PayPal Here SDK will call whenever a network request needs to go out.

Parameter.Name: delegate
Parameter.Abstract: an object implementing PPHNetworkRequestDelegate which will be in charge of executing requests

Token.Abstract: If you handle your own network requests, you should update the progress of those requests via this method so that various SDK features (such as reader software updates) can report overall progress back to you. This method is meant to allow you to get more precise about progress than is likely possible - so for example you could say a network request consists of connecting, uploading the request info, and downloading (3 totalSteps), and could assign estimated relative durations of each of those to be used in computing the total step units. But for the rest of us mortals, you'll probably just say it's 1 step and the percentage is the percentage of the download that's completed.

Parameter.Name: originalRequest
Parameter.Abstract: The request as originally passed to your network delegate. If you "rewrite" the request, you need to keep the old one around to properly inform us of progress.

Parameter.Name: currentStep
Parameter.Abstract: The 1-based index of the step currently executing (e.g. it doesn't make sense to be on the 0th step.

Parameter.Name: totalSteps
Parameter.Abstract: The count of the total number of steps required to execute the request. Must be at least 1.

Parameter.Name: wholeNumberCurrentPercentage
Parameter.Abstract: a number between 0 and 100 expressing how much of the current step is completed.

Parameter.Name: wholeNumberTotalPercentage
Parameter.Abstract: a number between 0 and 100 expressing how much of the total process is completed.

Token.Abstract: Should you wish to handle your own analytics, you can set this singleton. Be warned if you don't also let us do our own analytics we will not be able to help diagnose aggregate issues for our SDK in your application.

Parameter.Name: delegate
Parameter.Abstract: an object implementing PPHAnalyticsDelegate which will be in charge of reporting events

Token.Abstract: Should you wish to receive internal log messages, set this delegate. See PPHLogingDelegate for a warning about performance impact.

Parameter.Name: delegate
Parameter.Abstract: an object implementing one or more methods of the PPHLoggingDelegate

Token.Abstract: The current logging delegate or nil.

DEPRECATED - Use the version that takes a completion handler and encompasses the setupMerchant call as well. We hope this will lead to less cases where you think you've setup the SDK but something went wrong in the call to get status and account details.

Parameter.Name: merchant
Parameter.Abstract: The merchant information including OAuth credentials

Parameter.Name: asDefault
Parameter.Abstract: YES to securely store to keychain for future app runs, NO to keep in memory copy only

Token.Abstract: Set the currently active merchant for which all payment operations will be done. If asDefault is YES, we will persist this merchant information to secure storage and then when your app runs again, automatically pull it back out. If asDefault is NO you're on your own and activeMerchant will be nil when you run again. To "log the merchant out" you can call this with a nil merchant.

Parameter.Name: merchant
Parameter.Abstract: The merchant information including OAuth credentials

Parameter.Name: asDefault
Parameter.Abstract: YES to securely store to keychain for future app runs, NO to keep in memory copy only

Token.Abstract: Returns YES if we have the access we need to device location information (we ask for significant location changes so long as a transaction is in progress, or for general location updates if the device does not support significant updates).

To allow you fine grained control over location access prompts, you can call this method explicitly. It doesn't do anything more than ask for location, so you can certainly do that yourself and get control of the messaging, but this method is here for your convenience.
For TEST purposes, you can set the service URL used for requests in the PayPal Here SDK

Parameter.Name: url
Parameter.Abstract: The base URL (essentially https://stagename/) for your non-live environment.
